newsitem.title: USA: Glaxo gets okay for cystic fibrosis trials.
newsitem.headline: Glaxo gets okay for cystic fibrosis trials.

text.p: Glaxo Wellcome Plc and Megabios Corp said Thursday they have received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration to begin clinical trials of GR213487B, their gene-based therapeutic for cystic fibrosis.

The companies, which formed a corporate partnership in April 1994, said the Phase I/II trial would employ intranasal administration of the drug in patients with the genetic disease believed to afflict 60,000 in the U.S. and Europe.

Cystic fibrosis is caused by a mutation in the CFTR gene that produces a defective CFTR protein, leading to the build-up of mucus in the lungs that results in infections, loss of lung function and premature death.
The drug utilizes a proprietary Megabios gene delivery system to deliver the CFTR gene to the ciliated epithelial cells lining the lungs.
